publicationstmt.publisher: The Ohio State University Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Tom Moosbrugger using the OhioLINK EAD Application in 2012

did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: The Ohio State University Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum

did.abstract: Collection of original comic strips and cartoons, clippings of political cartoons, illustrated sheet music and miscellany.--Political cartoons and illustrations (1916-1917), Columbus Daily Monitor--Cap Stubbs and Tippie (daily comic strip) (1959-1961)--Tippie (Sunday strip) (1/18/48)--Alec the Great (dates unknown), with verses written by Robert Dennis Dumm--Sinbad (1923?)--sheet music: Shelter lullaby (1943); Tippie and the circus (1944); Tippie and the hurdy-gurdy (1947); Tippie's Hallowe'en serenade (1947); and the Christmas tree (1950)--photo, misc. papers, tape and transcript of oral history interview (2/15/85)

bioghist.head: Biography of Edwina Dumm
bioghist.p: Frances Edwina Dumm was born in Upper Sandusky, Ohio of a newspaper family. In 1916 she was the only woman to work full-time as an editorial cartoonist in America. She worked for the Columbus (Ohio) Saturday Monitor, later the Columbus Daily Monitor, 1915-1917. She is best known for her warm, friendly comic strip featuring a boy and his dog, Cap Stubbs and Tippie, which was syndicated by the George Matthew Adams Service in 1921 (The Sunday strips were distributed by King Features under the title Tippie). Other works included Sinbad, a comic strip which appeared in the old Life magazine and the London Tatler and Alec the Great, drawings which included four-line verses by her brother, Robert Dennis Dumm. She also illustrated books and sheet music, the latter in collaboration with Helen Thomas, who wrote the words and music. Edwina Dumm died in New York, New York, on April 28, 1990.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection of original comic strips and cartoons, clippings of political cartoons, illustrated sheet music and miscellany.--Political cartoons and illustrations (1916-1917), Columbus Daily Monitor--Cap Stubbs and Tippie (daily comic strip) (1959-1961)--Tippie (Sunday strip) (1/18/48)--Alec the Great (dates unknown), with verses written by Robert Dennis Dumm--Sinbad (1923?)--sheet music: Shelter lullaby (1943); Tippie and the circus (1944); Tippie and the hurdy-gurdy (1947); Tippie's Hallowe'en serenade (1947); and the Christmas tree (1950)--photo, misc. papers, tape and transcript of oral history interview (2/15/85)
Original art works in this collection may be found by searching the library's original art database.

arrangement.head: Statement of Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into ten series. Series I contains original artwork. Series II contains scrapbooks of political cartoon. Series III contains Tippie proofs and clippings. Series IV contains other materials relating to Tippie. Series V contains materials for Alec the Great and other comics. Series VI contains photographs. Series VII contains sheet music and other collaborations with Helen Thomas. Series VIII is the oral history interview with Edwina Dumm in 1987. Series IX contains personal and business correspondence. Series X contains diaries of Edwina Dumm, biographical information, memorabilia, and other assorted materials.

phystech.head: Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The Series VII: Oral History is available on audio cassette and compact disc. The collection also contains numerous photographic slides which require a projector for viewing.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Political cartoons limited to use of photocopies due to the fragility of the original clippings.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: All copyright laws pertain to any use or reproduction of published materials in the collection.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available for use in the library. Inventories of original cartoons are also available.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Box Number/Folder Number], Edwina Dumm Collection, The Ohio State University Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials received in a series of gifts starting in 1981; Estate of Edwina Dumm, 1991; Gift of Nancy Coe, 1993, and from the Estate of Nancy Coe, donated by Jennifer Coe and Amy Bickers in 2007-2008.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Comic books, strips, etc. -- United States
Caricatures and cartoons
Editorial cartoons
Women cartoonists -- United States
Dogs -- Caricatures and cartoons

scopecontent.p: Series I contains original art including color pencil drawings, watercolors and sketches by Edwina Dumm. Drawings and sketches from the series Cap Stubbs and Tippie, as well as oher comic series and characters, such as Mr. Socrates, Mr. Whiskers, and Squawk are included.
Original art works in this collection may be found by searching the library's original art database.

did.unittitle: Series II: Scrapbooks of political cartoons from the Columbus Daily Monitor and other clippings

scopecontent.p: Series II contains scrapbooks of clippings of editorial cartoons done by Edwina Dumm for the Columbus Daily Monitor. The scrapbooks have been disbound and the markings of "a" and "b" on pieces denote whether the clipping is from the obverse or reverse of the page. Any title followed by an asterisk (*) indicates it was dated from microfilm of the Columbus Daily Monitor. The clippings cover the years of 1916 and 1917, and cover issues such as World War I, the women's suffrage movement, and prohibition and temperance movements of the period. Photocopies of the clippings are included in the series and should be used in lieu of the clippings.

userestrict.p: Political cartoons limited to use of photocopies due to the fragility of the original clippings. For FED Box 1, Items 1-51b, use the photocopies contained in FED Box 1, Folder 52. For FED Box 2, Items 1-56, use the photocopies contained in FED Box 2, Folder 57.

Series III: Tippie proofs and clippings

scopecontent.p: Series III contains collections of proof sheets of the Tippie comic series. Proofs are preliminary versions of publications meant for review for examination or correction. The series also contains newspaper clippings of the strip, photographic slides of the strip, and photographs of proofs.
Proofs are numbered and range from #131082 to #134592.

Each folder contains a one year run of proofs. Some of the proofs are numbers including a range from #134593 to #137773. The runs of years 1942 (FED Box 4, Folder 11) and 1943 (FED Box 4, Folder 12) are incomplete.
Each folder contains a one year run of proofs. The runs of years 1948 (FED Box 5, Folder 1) and 1943 (FED Box 5, Folder 3) are incomplete.

did.unittitle: Sinbad logo and Tippie Sunday (8-3-1941) individual panel copies
Box of photographic slides of Tippie Sunday strips
Scrapbook of Tippie Sunday newspaper clippings

scopecontent.p: Series IV contains materials related to the Tippie character which are not proofs or clippings. The series contains script ideas for the cartoon, merchandise, and materials related to a Tippie film project.

did.unittitle: Tippie film credits layout and bills
Tippie and Cap Stubbs storyline books

scopecontent.p: Two hand-inked and watercolored dinner plates with the figure of Tippie. One is labeled with the text, "Tippie's Dinner Song."

processinfo.p: Plates received conservation treatment on October 15, 2012. The materials were dry cleaned, tape was removed, and the paper was mended by using heat-set paper.

Unique Tippie material (unpublished round songbook) and Alec the Great calendar
Mounted Tippie scene layouts with captions
Box of photographic slides of Tippie drawings

scopecontent.p: Some of the journals contain correspondence from Peter Wells.

did.unittitle: Series V: Alec the Great and other comics

scopecontent.p: Series V contains materials related to several animal characters created by Edwina Dumm, such as Alec the Great, Mr. Socrates, and Sinbad. The series contains sketches of the characters, proofs of the characters' comic strips, and a book by Edwina Dumm on drawing animals.

did.unittitle: Mister Socrates unfinished drawing and sketches
Mr. Socrates negatives of photographic proofs
Alec the Great sample release proofs

scopecontent.p: Proofs are primarily from 1949, 1954, 1955, and 1967.

did.unittitle: Alec the Great calendar and unique Tippie material (unpublished round songbook)
Alec the Great book ideas by Edwina and Robert Dumm
Book idea, How to Draw Dogs and Cats by Edwina

scopecontent.p: Series VI contains photographs of Edwina Dumm or the property of Edwina Dumm. The photographs are publicity photographs and personal photographs, including photographs of cartoon exhibitions. There are also photographs of the family of Edwina Dumm, which had been displayed in her apartment.

Series VII: Sheet music, musical scripts, and other Helen Thomas collaborations

scopecontent.p: Series VII contains records of the collaborative works between Edwina Dumm and songwriter and composer Helen Thomas and other sheet music. The series includes examples of sheet music illustrated by Edwina Dumm and featuring her characters. The series also contains drafts of plays created by Dumm and Thomas.

did.unittitle: Sheet music with illustrations by Edwina Dumm, words and music by Helen Thomas

scopecontent.p: Sheet music titles are: "Shelter Lullaby," "Tippie and the Circus," "Tippie's Christmas Carol," "Tippie's Love Song," "Tippie and the Hurdy-Gurdy," "Tippie's Hallowe'en Serenade," "The Christmas Tree"

scopecontent.p: Song titles are "Shelter Lullaby," "Tippie's Love Song," "Tippie and the Circus," "The Christmas Tree," "Tippie's Hallowe'en Serenade," "Tippie's Christmas Carol," and "Tippie and the Hurdy-Gurdy."

scopecontent.p: The song lyrics have a mention of Tippie

did.unittitle: Plays written by Edwina Dumm and Helen Thomas

scopecontent.p: Series VIII contains audio recordings and transcripts of an oral history interview conducted with Edwina Dumm from 1985.
Contains 2 audio cassettes, one as an archival copy, the other as a use copy, and 2 compact discs of the oral history interview.

phystech.p: Oral history is recorded on audio cassette and compact disc.

scopecontent.p: Series IX contains a variety of the personal and professional correspondence of Edwina Dumm. The series contains Christmas cards and letters, including some which were never mailed. There is business correspondence with the George Matthew Adams Service and Oriolo Films Studio Inc. as well.

did.unittitle: Christmas cards written but never sent
Oriolo Films Studio Inc. correspondence and Edwina Productions information
Series X: Biographical Material, Memorabilia, and Miscellaneous Items

scopecontent.p: Series X contains mostly personal artifacts of Edwina Dumm, such as calendars, articles about her and her characters, and various awards and certificates she received. The series also contains some of her personal notes and papers. The series contains the personal diaries of Edwina Dumm, spanning several decades later in her life, from 1960 until 1986.

scopecontent.p: Book covers include The Comics, by Coulton Waugh, Sinbad: A Dog's Life and Sinbad Again by Edwina. Magazine covers include Farm & Fireside, Life, and Good Old Days.

scopecontent.p: FED Box 12, Folder 1 spans March 18, 1963 to July 10, 1963. FED Box 12, Folder 2 spans January 20, 1964 to June 2, 1964. FED Box 12, Folder 3 spans June 6, 1964 to October 23, 1964. FED Box 12, Folder 4 spans June 3, 1965 to November 8, 1965. FED Box 12, Folder 5 spans November 9, 1965 to April 30, 1966. FED Box 12, Folder 6 spans April 2, 1966 to October 15, 1966. FED Box 12, Folder 7 spans October 16, 1966 to April 1, 1967. FED Box 12, Folder 8 spans September 30, 1967 to February 11, 1968. FED Box 12, Folder 9 spans July 22, 1968 to January 27, 1969. FED Box 12, Folder 10 spans January 27, 1969 to April 1, 1969. FED Box 12, Folder 11 spans September 4, 1969 to November 21, 1969. FED Box 12, Folder 12 spans June 8, 1970 to September 11, 1970. FED Box 12, Folder 13 spans September 12, 1970 to March 1971.

FED Box 13, Folder 1 spans July 10, 1971 to January 30, 1972. FED Box 13, Folder 2 spans January 30, 1972 to July 19, 1972. FED Box 13, Folder 3 spans November 28, 1972 to May 24, 1973. FED Box 13, Folder 4 spans May 25, 1973 to December 19, 1973. FED Box 13, Folder 5 spans December 19, 1973 to August 1, 1974. FED Box 13, Folder 6 spans November 1, 1974 to July 16, 1975. FED Box 13, Folder 7 spans July 18, 1975 to December 16, 1975. FED Box 13, Folder 8 spans December 17, 1975 to February 20, 1977. FED Box 13, Folder 9 spans February 20, 1977 to February 12, 1978. FED Box 13, Folder 10 spans November 20, 1978 to November 30, 1979. FED Box 13, Folder 11 spans December 1 1979 to January 24, 1981. FED Box 13, Folder 12 spans January 28, 1981 to July 5, 1986. FED Box 13, Folder 12 was donated from the Estate of Nancy Coe, by Amy Bickers, on August 11, 2008.
